topic_metadata.title: How do I add a supplement for a alphanumerical citation?

posts.name: jenny
posts.cooked: As title says: I’m lost. I found a GitHub Thread where they claimed that it’s fixed but it just will not work for me. Is “@Book[p.~5]” the wrong form? I’m on version 0.13.1 in the webapp
posts.raw: As title says: I'm lost. I found a GitHub Thread where they claimed that it's fixed but it just will not work for me. Is "@Book[p.~5]" the wrong form? I'm on version 0.13.1 in the webapp

posts.name: Eric Biedert
posts.cooked:
The issue is indeed fixed; however, the fix has not been released yet, so you will need to wait for Typst 0.14.

In the meantime, you can get a copy of the style’s fixed version from GitHub and upload it to your project on the Typst web app. There, you then just need to set the style to that file, as in

#set cite(style: "alphanumeric.csl")
posts.raw:
The [issue](https://github.com/typst/hayagriva/issues/48) is indeed fixed; however, the fix has not been released yet, so you will need to wait for Typst 0.14.

In the meantime, you can get a copy of the style's fixed version from [GitHub](https://github.com/typst/hayagriva/blob/main/styles/alphanumeric.csl) and upload it to your project on the Typst web app. There, you then just need to set the style to that file, as in
```typ
#set cite(style: "alphanumeric.csl")
```

posts.cooked: Hello. Please use backticks when referencing code snippets, and update your post.
posts.raw: Hello. Please use backticks when referencing code snippets, and update your post.
